info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 1:55PM MST until August 10 at 5:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 500 PM MST. * At 155 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across a large portion of the southern Haulapai Mountains including Alamo Crossing Road. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Alamo Crossing Road and secondary roads around the southern portion of the Hualapai Mountains. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
